definitions.title: adv.,
definitions.body: to-morrow in time to come (Aram. [[מְחַר]] mh.r; prob. properly time in front, Kö:ii. 263, cf. √, and As. maḫru, front, oft. of time, though alw. of former time, of old, Dl:HWB 402);—
to-morrow (the day following the present day),

definitions.title: a.
definitions.body: as subst. Ex 16:23 [[מָחָר]] ´[[שַׁבָּתוֹן שַׁבַּת קׂדֶשׁ לְי]] to-morrow is a sabbath, etc., 1Sa 20:5 [[חׂדֶשׁ מָחָר]] to-morrow is the new moon, v:1Sa 20:18; in [[יוֹם מָחָר]] †Ge 30:33, Pr 27:1, Is 56:12; in the idiom. phr. [[כָּעֵת מָחָר]] at the like of the time, (being) to-morrow, = about to-morrow (v. [[כְּ]]

definitions.title: b.
definitions.body: as adv. acc. Ex 8:25, Ex 9:5 [[מָחָר יַעֲשֶׂה]] [[הַדָּבָר הַזֶּה]] ´[[י]], Ex 10:4 [[הִנְנִי מֵבִיא מָחָר אַרְבֶּה]], Ex 17:9, Ex 32:5, Nu 14:25, 1Sa 11:9 etc., Jos 11:6 [[מָחָר כָּעֵת הַזּאׂת]]; opp. to [[הַיּוֹם]] Ex 19:10 [[הַיּוֹם וּמָחָר]], Jos 22:18, 2Sa 11:12 a; rhetorically, Is 22:13 [[כִּי מָחָר נׇמוּת]].
= in future time, Ex 13:14 [[כִּי יִשְׁאָֽלְ ְבִנְ ְמָחָר לֵאמׂר]] = De 6:20, Jos 4:6, Jos 4:21, Jos 22:24, Jos 22:27, Jos 22:28; so [[בְּיוֹם מָחָר]] Ge 30:33.
